alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 16 at 4:27PM MST until May 17 at 12:15AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Coconino County near Supai in north central Arizona... * Until 1215 AM MST Wednesday /115 AM MDT Wednesday/. * At 422 PM MST /522 PM MDT/, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms had produced heavy rain upstream of the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain fell. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Grand Canyon National Park, Supai and Havasupai Reservation. This includes the following swimming holes... All swimming holes on Havasu Creek near Supai. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Pasture Wash, Havasu Creek, Little Coyote Canyon and Colorado River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report any flooding to local law enforcement and the NWS Flagstaff when you can do so safely.
